    • Method Detail

      • getBitmap

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap getBitmap(android.net.Uri uri)
        Downloads an image from the internet or loads an image locally and returns a bitmap object. The image should be less than 450dp for the push notification. An aspect ratio of 2:1 is recommended. This should always be run in a background thread.

        According to http://developer.android.com/guide/appendix/media-formats.html, the supported file types are jpg and png.

        Parameters:
        uri - The uri where the image is found
        Returns:
        An image in Bitmap form. If the image cannot be downloaded, found on the filesystem, or cannot be decoded into a bitmap, then null is returned.

      • storePushBitmapInExternalStorage

        public static android.net.Uri storePushBitmapInExternalStorage(android.content.Context context,
                                                               android.graphics.Bitmap imageBitmap,
                                                               java.lang.String imageFilenameBase,
                                                               java.lang.String folderName)
        Store the given bitmap image locally as a png file in the specified external directory. Currently used to store images externally for sharing via push share actions.
        Parameters:
        context -
        imageBitmap - image bitmap
        imageFilenameBase - desired image filename, without file extension
        folderName - folder name for the image
        Returns:
        the image Uri, or null if saving locally failed.

      • getPixelsFromDensityAndDp

        public static int getPixelsFromDensityAndDp(int dpi,
                                            int dp)
        Parameters:
        dpi - dpi of the screen
        dp - dimension of the original image
        Returns:
        an adjusted dimension in pixels for an image for display in big image push.

      • calculateMaxCacheSize

        public static int calculateMaxCacheSize()
        This method calculates the maximum cached memory size, caps it to integer maximum value to prevent overflow.
        Returns:
        size in bytes
